sites.name: Prague Castle
sites.description: The largest ancient castle in the world according to Guinness Book of Records, Prague Castle is a vast complex of palaces, churches, courtyards and gardens. Home to St. Vitus Cathedral, Old Royal Palace, and the stunning St. George's Basilica, it has been the seat of Czech rulers for over 1000 years.
sites.seasonal_notes: Best visited early morning to avoid crowds. Summer offers longer hours and special exhibitions. Winter provides a magical snow-covered atmosphere.
sites.booking_tips: Book tickets online to skip queues. Choose the appropriate circuit based on time available. Audio guides highly recommended.

sites.name: Charles Bridge
sites.description: Prague's most iconic landmark, this 14th-century stone bridge connects Old Town and Lesser Town across the Vltava River. Lined with 30 baroque statues and bustling with street artists, musicians, and vendors, it offers stunning views of the castle and city.
sites.seasonal_notes: Magical at sunrise with fewer crowds. Evening offers beautiful lighting. Winter can be slippery but atmospheric with snow.
sites.booking_tips: Visit early morning or late evening to avoid crowds. Perfect for photography and street performances.

sites.name: Old Town Square
sites.description: The heart of Prague's historic center, featuring the famous Astronomical Clock, Gothic Týn Church, Baroque St. Nicholas Church, and colorful baroque buildings. This UNESCO World Heritage site has been Prague's principal public square since the 10th century.
sites.seasonal_notes: Christmas markets create magical atmosphere in winter. Summer brings outdoor cafes and street performances. Astronomical Clock shows draw crowds hourly.
sites.booking_tips: Free to visit. Visit at the top of each hour for the Astronomical Clock show. Early morning offers fewer crowds for photos.

sites.name: Astronomical Clock (Orloj)
sites.description: The world's third-oldest astronomical clock and the oldest one still operating, dating from 1410. Every hour on the hour, crowds gather to watch the procession of the Twelve Apostles and the striking of the time.
sites.seasonal_notes: Hourly shows year-round. Tower access available for panoramic city views. Winter shows are less crowded.
sites.booking_tips: Arrive 10-15 minutes before the hour for the show. Tower climb requires separate ticket and offers great city views.

sites.name: St. Vitus Cathedral
sites.description: A magnificent Gothic cathedral within Prague Castle complex, featuring stunning stained glass windows, royal tombs, and the crown jewels. This architectural masterpiece took nearly 600 years to complete and is the spiritual heart of the Czech Republic.
sites.seasonal_notes: Beautiful year-round. Summer offers longer visiting hours. Stained glass is most spectacular when sunlight streams through.
sites.booking_tips: Included in Prague Castle tickets. Visit early morning for better photo opportunities and fewer crowds.

sites.name: Jewish Quarter (Josefov)
sites.description: One of Europe's most significant Jewish historical sites, featuring synagogues, the Jewish cemetery, and the Jewish Museum. The area preserves nearly 1000 years of Jewish history and culture in Prague.
sites.seasonal_notes: Year-round attraction. Guided tours provide deeper historical context. Closed on Saturdays and Jewish holidays.
sites.booking_tips: Book tickets online for the Jewish Museum circuit. Allow 2-3 hours for complete visit. Guided tours highly recommended.

sites.name: Wenceslas Square
sites.description: Prague's main commercial district and cultural center, this broad boulevard is lined with shops, restaurants, hotels, and historic buildings. Site of many important historical events including the Velvet Revolution demonstrations.
sites.seasonal_notes: Vibrant nightlife in summer. Christmas markets in winter. Beautiful illumination in the evening.
sites.booking_tips: Free to visit. Great for shopping and dining. Evening offers the best atmosphere.

sites.name: Petřín Hill and Tower
sites.description: A large hill offering panoramic views of Prague, featuring the Petřín Lookout Tower (Prague's mini Eiffel Tower), beautiful gardens, and peaceful walking paths. Perfect for escaping the city crowds.
sites.seasonal_notes: Spring brings blooming flowers. Autumn offers colorful foliage. Tower offers 360-degree city views.
sites.booking_tips: Take the funicular railway up or enjoy the scenic walk. Tower climb requires separate ticket.

sites.name: Dancing House
sites.description: A striking example of deconstructivist architecture designed by Vlado Milunić and Frank Gehry. This modern building contrasts beautifully with Prague's historic architecture and houses a hotel, restaurant, and gallery.
sites.seasonal_notes: Year-round attraction. Rooftop bar offers great city views. Best photographed from the riverside.
sites.booking_tips: Free to admire from outside. Restaurant and gallery visits require payment. Rooftop bar reservations recommended.

sites.name: Lennon Wall
sites.description: A colorful graffiti wall filled with John Lennon-inspired messages of peace, love, and freedom. Since the 1980s, it has been a symbol of hope and rebellion, constantly changing as visitors add their own messages.
sites.seasonal_notes: Year-round attraction. Always evolving with new artwork. Popular photo spot for visitors.
sites.booking_tips: Free to visit. Bring your own marker to add a message. Located near Charles Bridge in Lesser Town.

sites.name: Prague National Theatre
sites.description: A stunning neo-Renaissance building that serves as the primary opera and ballet venue in Prague. Known for its beautiful interior, rich cultural programming, and significant role in Czech national identity.
sites.seasonal_notes: Year-round performances. Summer brings special festivals. Winter season offers classic repertoire.
sites.booking_tips: Book tickets well in advance for popular performances. Guided tours available during the day.

sites.name: Kampa Island
sites.description: A peaceful island park in the Vltava River, featuring beautiful gardens, art installations, and charming views of the city. Often called 'Prague's Venice' due to its canal and waterside atmosphere.
sites.seasonal_notes: Beautiful in all seasons. Spring and summer offer lush greenery. Autumn provides colorful foliage.
sites.booking_tips: Free to visit. Perfect for picnics and leisurely walks. Access via Charles Bridge or Kampa Museum.

sites.name: Vltava River Cruise
sites.description: Scenic boat cruises along the Vltava River offering unique perspectives of Prague's historic landmarks including Prague Castle, Charles Bridge, and the National Theatre from the water.
sites.seasonal_notes: Available year-round, but especially magical at sunset when monuments are illuminated. Summer offers longer evening cruises.
sites.booking_tips: Book online for discounts. Evening cruises with dinner available. Choose boats with outdoor decks for best views.

sites.name: Prague Zoo
sites.description: One of the world's top-rated zoos, featuring over 4,200 animals in naturalistic habitats. Famous for successful breeding programs and beautiful location in Troja valley with great views of Prague.
sites.seasonal_notes: Best visited in spring and summer when animals are most active. Some indoor exhibits available year-round.
sites.booking_tips: Purchase tickets online to avoid queues. Allow 3-4 hours for complete visit. Take bus or train to Troja.

sites.name: Vyšehrad Castle
sites.description: A historic castle complex on a hill overlooking the Vltava River, featuring beautiful gardens, the Vyšehrad Cemetery where many famous Czechs are buried, and stunning views of Prague.
sites.seasonal_notes: Beautiful in all seasons. Spring brings blooming flowers in the gardens. Sunset offers magical views.
sites.booking_tips: Free to explore the grounds. Some exhibitions require tickets. Less crowded than Prague Castle.

sites.name: Municipal House
sites.description: A stunning Art Nouveau building housing Prague's premier concert hall, featuring elaborate decorations, beautiful restaurants, and regular classical music performances. An architectural gem from the early 20th century.
sites.seasonal_notes: Year-round concerts and events. Guided tours available during the day. New Year's concerts are particularly special.
sites.booking_tips: Book concert tickets in advance. Guided tours show the magnificent interiors. Café and restaurant open daily.

sites.name: St. Nicholas Church (Lesser Town)
sites.description: A magnificent Baroque church with an impressive dome and bell tower, featuring beautiful frescoes and organ concerts. One of Prague's most important Baroque buildings with stunning interior decorations.
sites.seasonal_notes: Beautiful year-round. Regular organ concerts enhance the experience. Tower climb offers great views.
sites.booking_tips: Small entry fee for church. Tower climb requires separate ticket. Check for concert schedule.

sites.name: Prague Beer Garden (Letná)
sites.description: Prague's largest beer garden located in Letná Park, offering traditional Czech beers, pub food, and panoramic views of the city. A perfect place to experience Czech beer culture.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open primarily in warmer months (April-October). Sunset hours offer the best atmosphere and views.
sites.booking_tips: No reservations needed. Bring cash as cards may not be accepted. Combine with a walk in Letná Park.

sites.name: Prague Metronome
sites.description: A giant metronome standing where Stalin's monument once was, this modern art installation has become an unexpected symbol of Prague. Located in Letná Park with excellent city views.
sites.seasonal_notes: Year-round attraction. Excellent spot for panoramic photography. Popular with skateboarders and locals.
sites.booking_tips: Free to visit. Accessible by walking through Letná Park. Great viewpoint for Prague Castle and Old Town.

sites.name: Franz Kafka Museum
sites.description: Dedicated to Prague's most famous literary son, this museum explores Kafka's life and work through interactive exhibits, manuscripts, and multimedia presentations in a atmospheric setting.
sites.seasonal_notes: Year-round attraction. Dark and atmospheric interior provides escape from weather. Literary exhibitions change periodically.
sites.booking_tips: Purchase tickets online or at venue. Audio guides available. Located near Charles Bridge in Lesser Town.

neighborhoods.name: Old Town (Staré Město)
neighborhoods.character: The medieval heart of Prague with cobblestone streets, Gothic architecture, and the famous Astronomical Clock.

location.description: Located on the right bank of the Vltava River, this is the historic center of Prague.

history.overview: Founded in the 9th century, this is Prague's oldest settlement and the original heart of the city.
history.significance: UNESCO World Heritage site and the historic core of Prague for over 1000 years.

practical_info.safety: Very safe with constant tourist activity and police presence.
practical_info.best_time_to_visit: Early morning to avoid crowds, evening for atmospheric lighting.
practical_info.walkability: Excellent - cobblestone pedestrian areas and compact layout.

attractions.name: Old Town Square
attractions.description: The heart of Prague with colorful baroque buildings, Gothic churches, and the famous Astronomical Clock.
attractions.appeal: Watch the hourly clock show and admire the stunning architecture.

attractions.name: Astronomical Clock
attractions.description: Medieval astronomical clock with animated figures performing every hour.
attractions.appeal: One of the world's oldest working astronomical clocks.

attractions.name: Týn Church
attractions.description: Iconic Gothic church with distinctive twin spires dominating Old Town Square.
attractions.appeal: Beautiful Gothic architecture and significant religious history.

dining.name: Café Savoy
dining.known_for: Elegant Belle Époque atmosphere and traditional dishes

dining.name: Lokál
dining.known_for: Fresh Pilsner Urquell and authentic Czech cuisine

dining.name: U Zlaté studně
dining.known_for: Panoramic city views and gourmet cuisine

activities.name: Historic Walking Tour
activities.description: Explore medieval streets and learn about Prague's rich history.

activities.name: Church and Architecture Tour
activities.description: Visit Gothic and Baroque churches and historic buildings.

stay_here_if: You want to be in the heart of Prague's historic attractions
You love medieval architecture and historic atmosphere
avoid_if: You prefer quieter, less touristy areas
You want modern amenities and nightlife
insider_tips: Visit the Astronomical Clock 10 minutes before the hour for the best viewing spot.
Explore the narrow side streets for hidden courtyards and fewer crowds.

neighborhoods.name: Lesser Town (Malá Strana)
neighborhoods.character: A baroque jewel beneath Prague Castle with palaces, gardens, and charming cobblestone streets.

location.description: Located on the left bank of the Vltava River, beneath Prague Castle.

history.overview: Founded in 1257, this area became the aristocratic quarter with beautiful Baroque palaces.
history.significance: Home to nobility and embassies, featuring the best preserved Baroque architecture in Prague.

transit: Walking distance from Old Town via Charles Bridge
practical_info.safety: Very safe with embassy security and tourist presence.
practical_info.best_time_to_visit: Morning for peaceful exploration, afternoon for gardens.
practical_info.walkability: Excellent but hilly - comfortable walking shoes recommended.

attractions.name: Charles Bridge
attractions.description: Iconic 14th-century stone bridge with baroque statues and street artists.
attractions.appeal: Prague's most famous landmark with stunning castle views.

attractions.name: St. Nicholas Church
attractions.description: Magnificent Baroque church with impressive dome and frescoes.
attractions.appeal: One of Prague's most beautiful Baroque interiors.

attractions.name: Wallenstein Garden
attractions.description: Beautiful formal garden with peacocks, fountains, and artificial grotto.
attractions.appeal: Peaceful oasis with stunning baroque landscape design.

dining.name: Augustine Restaurant
dining.known_for: Luxury monastery setting and gourmet cuisine

dining.name: Hergetova Cihelna
dining.known_for: Charles Bridge views and modern cuisine

dining.name: U Maltézských rytířů
dining.known_for: Historic cellar dining and traditional dishes

activities.name: Palace and Garden Tour
activities.description: Explore baroque palaces and their beautiful gardens.

activities.name: Charles Bridge Walk
activities.description: Cross the famous bridge and enjoy street performances.

stay_here_if: You appreciate baroque architecture and elegant surroundings
You want proximity to Prague Castle and beautiful gardens
avoid_if: You prefer modern amenities and vibrant nightlife
You want to avoid hills and stairs
insider_tips: Visit the gardens early morning for peaceful atmosphere and best photos.
Look for hidden courtyards and palace gardens open to the public.

neighborhoods.name: New Town (Nové Město)
neighborhoods.character: Prague's bustling commercial and cultural center with wide boulevards, shops, and vibrant nightlife.

location.description: Surrounding the Old Town on three sides, this is Prague's main commercial district.

history.overview: Founded in 1348 by Charles IV, it was one of the largest urban planning projects of medieval Europe.
history.significance: Center of Czech national revival and site of many historic events including the Velvet Revolution.

practical_info.safety: Generally safe but watch for pickpockets in crowded areas.
practical_info.best_time_to_visit: Evening for nightlife, daytime for shopping and culture.
practical_info.walkability: Very good with wide sidewalks and pedestrian areas.

attractions.name: Wenceslas Square
attractions.description: Prague's main commercial street and site of many historic events.
attractions.appeal: Shopping, dining, and significant historical importance.

attractions.name: National Theatre
attractions.description: Stunning neo-Renaissance building hosting opera, ballet, and drama.

attractions.name: Dancing House
attractions.description: Controversial deconstructivist building designed by Frank Gehry.
attractions.appeal: Striking modern architecture contrasting with historic Prague.

dining.name: Café Slavia
dining.known_for: Historic café with National Theatre views

activities.name: Shopping on Wenceslas Square
activities.description: Explore Prague's main shopping street and department stores.

activities.name: National Theatre Performance
activities.description: Attend opera, ballet, or drama at Prague's premier venue.

stay_here_if: You want to be near shopping, dining, and cultural venues
You enjoy vibrant urban atmosphere and nightlife
avoid_if: You want to avoid crowds and traffic
insider_tips: Book National Theatre tickets well in advance for popular performances.
Explore the art nouveau buildings along the main streets.

neighborhoods.name: Castle Quarter (Hradčany)
neighborhoods.character: The royal quarter surrounding Prague Castle with magnificent views, palaces, and gardens.

location.description: Located on a hill above Lesser Town, centered around Prague Castle.

history.overview: Historic seat of Czech rulers for over 1000 years, center of political and religious power.
history.significance: Home to Prague Castle, the largest ancient castle complex in the world.
notable_events: Founding of Prague Castle in 9th century
Seat of Czechoslovak and Czech presidents

practical_info.safety: Very safe with castle security and tourist police.
practical_info.best_time_to_visit: Early morning to avoid crowds, late afternoon for golden light.
practical_info.walkability: Good but very hilly - expect steep climbs and stairs.

attractions.name: Prague Castle
attractions.description: The largest ancient castle in the world with palaces, churches, and gardens.
attractions.appeal: Over 1000 years of Czech history in one magnificent complex.

attractions.name: St. Vitus Cathedral
attractions.description: Magnificent Gothic cathedral with stunning stained glass and royal tombs.
attractions.appeal: Masterpiece of Gothic architecture and spiritual heart of Czech Republic.

attractions.name: Royal Gardens
attractions.description: Beautiful Renaissance gardens with seasonal flowers and historic buildings.
attractions.appeal: Peaceful gardens with stunning views and historic architecture.

dining.name: U Černého vola
dining.known_for: Authentic local atmosphere and cheap beer

activities.name: Prague Castle Tour
activities.description: Explore the castle complex, cathedral, and royal apartments.

activities.name: Castle Gardens Walk
activities.description: Stroll through beautiful Renaissance and Baroque gardens.

stay_here_if: You want to be near Prague Castle and historic sites
You enjoy panoramic views and don't mind walking uphill
avoid_if: You have mobility issues or prefer flat terrain
You want vibrant nightlife and dining options
insider_tips: Buy castle tickets online to skip lines, especially in summer.
Visit Royal Gardens in spring for the best flower displays.

neighborhoods.name: Vinohrady
neighborhoods.character: An elegant residential neighborhood with beautiful Art Nouveau architecture, parks, and a local atmosphere.

location.description: Located southeast of New Town, this is Prague's most desirable residential area.

history.overview: Former royal vineyards transformed into an elegant residential district in the 19th century.
history.significance: Prague's premier residential area known for Art Nouveau architecture and upscale living.

practical_info.safety: Very safe residential area with low crime rates.
practical_info.best_time_to_visit: Any time - great for morning walks and evening dining.
practical_info.walkability: Excellent with tree-lined streets and sidewalks.

attractions.name: Náměstí Míru
attractions.description: Beautiful square with Church of St. Ludmila and Art Nouveau buildings.
attractions.appeal: Perfect example of Prague's residential elegance and architecture.

attractions.name: Riegrovy sady
attractions.description: Large park with beer garden, playground, and stunning city views.
attractions.appeal: Popular local hangout with the best beer garden views in Prague.

attractions.name: Náměstí Jiřího z Poděbrad
attractions.description: Farmers market square with modernist church and local atmosphere.
attractions.appeal: Saturday farmers market and authentic local neighborhood feel.

dining.name: Café Louvre
dining.known_for: Historic café where Einstein and Kafka met

activities.name: Art Nouveau Architecture Walk
activities.description: Explore beautiful Art Nouveau buildings and residential streets.

activities.name: Riegrovy sady Beer Garden
activities.description: Enjoy Czech beer with locals while overlooking the city.

stay_here_if: You want to experience local Prague life away from tourist crowds
You appreciate elegant architecture and peaceful residential areas
avoid_if: You want to be walking distance from major tourist attractions
You prefer vibrant nightlife and entertainment districts
insider_tips: Visit the Saturday farmers market at Náměstí Jiřího z Poděbrad for local products.
The beer garden at Riegrovy sady offers the best sunset views in Prague.

neighborhoods.name: Jewish Quarter (Josefov)
neighborhoods.character: A historically significant district preserving nearly 1000 years of Jewish heritage in Central Europe.

location.description: Located between Old Town Square and the Vltava River, within Old Town.

history.overview: One of Europe's oldest Jewish settlements, preserving nearly a millennium of Jewish culture and history.
history.significance: Contains the oldest active synagogue in Europe and one of the world's oldest Jewish cemeteries.
notable_events: Establishment of Jewish community in 10th century

transit: Walking distance from Old Town Square
practical_info.safety: Very safe with museum security and tourist presence.
practical_info.best_time_to_visit: Morning for quieter museum visits, closed on Saturdays and Jewish holidays.
practical_info.walkability: Excellent - compact area within Old Town.

attractions.name: Old Jewish Cemetery
attractions.description: One of the oldest Jewish cemeteries in Europe with over 12,000 tombstones.
attractions.appeal: Deeply moving historical site with centuries of Jewish history.

attractions.name: Old-New Synagogue
attractions.description: The oldest active synagogue in Europe, built in 1270.
attractions.appeal: Stunning Gothic architecture and continuous religious use for 750 years.

attractions.name: Jewish Museum
attractions.description: Comprehensive museum preserving Jewish history and culture in Bohemia.
attractions.appeal: World's largest collection of Jewish artifacts outside Israel.

dining.name: King Solomon
dining.known_for: Kosher cuisine and Jewish cultural atmosphere

dining.name: Café Slavia
dining.known_for: Historic meeting place and Prague views

activities.name: Jewish Heritage Tour
activities.description: Comprehensive tour of synagogues, cemetery, and museum.

activities.name: Synagogue Visits
activities.description: Visit multiple historic synagogues and learn about Jewish traditions.

stay_here_if: You're interested in Jewish history and culture
You want to be in the historic center with easy access to cultural sites
avoid_if: You're looking for vibrant nightlife and entertainment
You prefer modern amenities and contemporary atmosphere
insider_tips: Buy combination tickets for all synagogues and the cemetery for better value.
Respect the solemn nature of the sites and dress appropriately.

fine_dining.name: Field Restaurant
fine_dining.atmosphere: Elegant and contemporary with a focus on Czech ingredients
fine_dining.booking_tips: Book at least two weeks in advance, especially on weekends
fine_dining.local_tips: Try their tasting menu for the full experience of modern Czech cuisine with wine pairings

fine_dining.name: La Degustation Bohême Bourgeoise
fine_dining.atmosphere: Intimate and sophisticated with historic charm
fine_dining.booking_tips: Reservations essential, book months in advance
fine_dining.local_tips: Experience Czech haute cuisine with their multi-course tasting menu

fine_dining.name: Augustine Restaurant
fine_dining.atmosphere: Luxurious monastery setting with vaulted ceilings
fine_dining.booking_tips: Book at least one month in advance for weekend dining
fine_dining.local_tips: Dine in the historic monastery setting for an unforgettable atmosphere

fine_dining.name: Terasa U Zlaté studně
fine_dining.atmosphere: Romantic terrace with panoramic Prague views
fine_dining.booking_tips: Request terrace seating for the best city views
fine_dining.local_tips: Visit at sunset for breathtaking views over Prague's rooftops

casual_dining.name: Lokál
casual_dining.atmosphere: Bustling beer hall with communal tables
casual_dining.booking_tips: Arrive early to avoid crowds, especially during lunch
casual_dining.local_tips: Try their excellent Pilsner Urquell on tap and traditional Czech sides

casual_dining.name: U Fleků
casual_dining.atmosphere: Historic brewery with beer hall atmosphere
casual_dining.booking_tips: Book ahead for traditional Czech beer hall experience
casual_dining.local_tips: Try their famous dark beer brewed on-site since 1499

casual_dining.name: Café Savoy
casual_dining.atmosphere: Elegant Belle Époque café with high ceilings
casual_dining.booking_tips: Reserve for weekend brunch or afternoon coffee
casual_dining.local_tips: Perfect for traditional Central European café culture experience

casual_dining.name: Havelská Koruna
casual_dining.atmosphere: Historic restaurant with traditional Czech decor
casual_dining.booking_tips: Popular with locals, arrive early for lunch
casual_dining.local_tips: Try their daily lunch specials and homemade bread

casual_dining.name: Restaurace U Kalicha
casual_dining.atmosphere: Traditional pub atmosphere with Czech memorabilia
casual_dining.booking_tips: Famous literary connections, visit for authentic Czech atmosphere
casual_dining.local_tips: Known from the novel 'The Good Soldier Švejk', try traditional Czech dishes

casual_dining.name: Zdeněk's Oyster Bar
casual_dining.atmosphere: Cozy seafood bar with maritime decor
casual_dining.booking_tips: Book ahead for fresh seafood selection
casual_dining.local_tips: Unusual for Prague but excellent fresh seafood flown in daily

street_food.name: Wenceslas Square Food Vendors
street_food.local_tips: Try the traditional klobása with mustard and fresh bread

street_food.name: Old Town Square Christmas Market
street_food.local_tips: Visit during Christmas season for traditional Czech holiday treats

street_food.name: Farmers Market at Náměstí Jiřího z Poděbrad
street_food.local_tips: Saturday market with local producers and fresh ingredients

street_food.name: Food Trucks at Kampa Island
street_food.local_tips: Modern street food with Vltava River views

coffee_shops.atmosphere: Historic and elegant with Art Nouveau decor
coffee_shops.food_options: Traditional Central European pastries and light meals
coffee_shops.local_tips: Sit in the historic main hall where Einstein and Kafka once met

coffee_shops.name: Café Slavia
coffee_shops.atmosphere: Historic with views of Prague Castle and National Theatre
coffee_shops.food_options: Classic Czech café fare and light meals
coffee_shops.local_tips: Perfect spot for castle views and traditional Prague café experience

coffee_shops.name: Myšák Café

coffee_shops.local_tips: Try their famous Czech pastries and traditional coffee preparation

coffee_shops.local_tips: Prague's premier specialty coffee roaster with multiple locations

coffee_shops.name: Café Obecní dům
coffee_shops.atmosphere: Stunning Art Nouveau interior in Municipal House
coffee_shops.local_tips: Experience Prague's most beautiful café interior in the Municipal House

bars.name: U Zlatého tygra (Golden Tiger)
bars.atmosphere: Authentic Czech pub with locals and history
bars.local_tips: Famous pub where Václav Havel brought Bill Clinton, authentic local experience

bars.name: Hemingway Bar
bars.local_tips: Hidden entrance, ask locals for directions to this award-winning cocktail bar

bars.name: Tretter's
bars.local_tips: Prague's first proper cocktail bar, known for excellent classic cocktails

bars.name: Beer Museum Prague
bars.atmosphere: Beer hall with educational beer museum
bars.local_tips: Try beer flights to sample different Czech brewery styles

bars.name: Letná Beer Garden
bars.atmosphere: Outdoor seating with panoramic Prague views
bars.local_tips: Prague's largest beer garden with stunning city views, perfect for sunset

food_tours.booking_tips: Book at least a week in advance, especially for weekend tours

food_tours.name: Prague Beer and Brewery Tour
food_tours.booking_tips: Include transportation between breweries, book in advance

food_tours.name: Prague Market and Cooking Tour
food_tours.booking_tips: Morning start for market freshness, book well in advance

cooking_classes.booking_tips: Reserve your spot at least two weeks in advance

cooking_classes.name: Czech Pastry and Dessert Class
cooking_classes.booking_tips: Check for seasonal classes and holiday specials

cooking_classes.name: Prague Beer and Food Pairing Class
cooking_classes.booking_tips: Must be 18+, book in advance for weekend sessions

markets.local_tips: Prague's oldest market, great for fresh produce and local souvenirs

markets.name: Farmers Market at Náměstí Jiřího z Poděbrad
markets.local_tips: Saturday only, arrive early for best selection of local products

markets.name: Manifesto Market
markets.local_tips: Modern food court with diverse international options and local crafts

local_specialties.description: Czech national dish of marinated beef sirloin with cream sauce, bread dumplings, and cranberry sauce.
Hearty beef stew with onions, paprika, and traditional Czech bread dumplings.
Classic Czech meal of roasted pork, bread dumplings, and sauerkraut or red cabbage.
Traditional Czech garlic soup, often served with bread, cheese, and sometimes egg.
Breaded and fried cutlet (usually pork or chicken) served with potato salad or boiled potatoes.
Traditional Czech sweet pastries filled with poppy seeds, cheese, plums, or other fruits.
Sweet pastry rolled in sugar and nuts, cooked on a rotating spit (popular tourist treat).
Open-faced sandwiches with various toppings, popular for quick meals and snacks.

drinks.name: Pilsner Urquell
drinks.description: The original Pilsner lager, first brewed in nearby Plzeň in 1842. Must-try on tap in Prague.

drinks.name: Budweiser Budvar
drinks.description: Original Budweiser beer from České Budějovice, smooth and well-balanced Czech lager.

drinks.name: Staropramen
drinks.description: Prague's own brewery, light and refreshing lager brewed in the city since 1869.

drinks.name: Becherovka
drinks.description: Traditional Czech herbal liqueur from Karlovy Vary, often served as a digestif or with tonic.

drinks.name: Slivovice
drinks.description: Traditional Czech plum brandy, often homemade and served as a strong digestif.

drinks.name: Czech wine
drinks.description: Excellent wines from Moravia region, especially white wines like Riesling and Grüner Veltliner.

drinks.name: Svařák
drinks.description: Czech mulled wine, popular during winter months and Christmas markets.

drinks.name: Kofola
drinks.description: Popular Czech cola soft drink with a unique herbal flavor, a local alternative to international colas.

destinations.whyGo: Czech Republic's second largest city with modern architecture, vibrant cultural scene, and excellent universities.
Industrial heritage city with unique mining museums, contemporary culture, and vibrant nightlife.
Historic city known for Budweiser beer, beautiful Renaissance architecture, and gateway to South Bohemia.
The birthplace of Pilsner beer with historic brewery tours, beautiful cathedral, and charming old town.
Famous spa town with thermal springs, elegant architecture, and international film festival.
Medieval fairy-tale town with stunning castle and UNESCO World Heritage old town.
Imperial capital with stunning palaces, world-class classical music, and elegant coffee house culture.
Known for its annual Oktoberfest celebration, beer halls, excellent museums, and beautiful architecture blending tradition and modernity.
Dynamic capital blending history and modernity with vibrant arts scene, museums, and nightlife.
Baroque jewel with stunning architecture, excellent museums, and rich cultural heritage.
A major financial hub with a futuristic skyline, excellent museums, historic old town, and vibrant cultural scene.
Historic city with medieval architecture, famous Christmas markets, and rich cultural heritage.
Renowned for its well-preserved medieval old town, excellent museums, beautiful lake setting, and high quality of life.
Stunning architecture, thermal baths, vibrant nightlife, and rich cultural heritage along the Danube.
Charming capital with medieval old town, hilltop castle, and Danube riverfront.
Dynamic capital with rich history, excellent museums, and vibrant cultural scene.
Historic city with stunning medieval old town, Wawel Castle, and rich cultural heritage.
Famous for its artistic heritage, elaborate canal system, narrow houses, world-class museums, and vibrant cultural scene.
Vibrant capital of Belgium and the European Union, known for its historic Grand Place, Art Nouveau architecture, and excellent beer culture.
The City of Light with iconic landmarks, world-class museums, and vibrant cultural scene.
A leading global city with strengths in the arts, commerce, finance, and culture, featuring iconic landmarks and diverse neighborhoods.
The Eternal City with ancient ruins, Vatican City, Renaissance art, and vibrant street life.
Italy's fashion and design capital with stunning Gothic cathedral, world-class shopping, and excellent cuisine.
Famous for its art and architecture, especially Gaudí's masterpieces, vibrant cultural scene, and Mediterranean beaches.
The Spanish capital known for its rich repositories of European art, vibrant cultural scene, and excellent cuisine.
Scandinavian charm with excellent design, beautiful waterfront, vibrant cultural scene, and bike-friendly atmosphere.
Beautiful archipelago setting, excellent museums, Scandinavian design culture, and Nobel Prize heritage.
Scenic fjord setting, excellent museums, modern architecture, and gateway to Norwegian nature.
Vibrant capital with rich literary heritage, excellent pubs, friendly atmosphere, and Georgian architecture.
Charming coastal capital with historic trams, beautiful viewpoints, excellent cuisine, and maritime heritage.
Ancient capital with Acropolis, rich history, excellent museums, and gateway to Greek islands.
Where East meets West with stunning mosques, Grand Bazaar, Bosphorus views, and rich cultural heritage.

activities.name: Cherry Blossom Viewing at Petřín Hill
activities.description: Experience the stunning cherry blossoms in full bloom at Petřín Hill and the adjacent parks. The hill offers beautiful springtime displays and panoramic views of Prague Castle.
activities.seasonal_notes: Spring is the perfect time to enjoy the cherry blossoms, which typically bloom from late March to mid-April.
activities.booking_tips: Take the funicular up Petřín Hill and bring a camera to capture the blossoms with Prague Castle in the background.

activities.name: Visit to the National Gallery
activities.description: Discover Czech and international art at the National Gallery's various locations, including the stunning Veletržní Palace and the historic St. Agnes Convent.
activities.seasonal_notes: Spring rains can be unpredictable, making indoor museum visits an ideal activity.
activities.booking_tips: Purchase tickets online in advance and consider visiting multiple gallery locations with a combined ticket.

activities.name: Night of Museums (Noc muzeí)
activities.description: Participate in the Night of Museums in May, where many Prague museums open their doors for free or reduced prices, offering special activities and exhibitions.
activities.seasonal_notes: This annual event celebrates Czech culture and history, making it a must-do spring activity.
activities.booking_tips: Check the participating museums and plan your route in advance, as popular venues can get crowded.

activities.name: Picnic at Kampa Island
activities.description: Enjoy a leisurely picnic on Kampa Island, a peaceful oasis in the heart of Prague with beautiful views of Charles Bridge and the castle.
activities.seasonal_notes: The island comes alive in spring with blooming flowers and pleasant weather.
activities.booking_tips: Pick up fresh chlebíčky (open sandwiches) and Czech beer from local shops to enhance your picnic experience.

activities.name: Rooftop Bar at Terasa U Prince
activities.description: Sip cocktails while enjoying stunning views of Old Town Square and the Astronomical Clock at this popular rooftop bar.
activities.seasonal_notes: Spring evenings are mild and perfect for enjoying outdoor terraces with views.
activities.booking_tips: Make reservations in advance, especially for sunset hours and weekends.

activities.name: Easter Markets at Old Town Square
activities.description: Visit the traditional Easter markets featuring Czech crafts, painted eggs, traditional foods like mazanec, and live folk performances from March to April.
activities.seasonal_notes: This spring festival celebrates Czech Easter traditions with authentic crafts and foods.
activities.booking_tips: Visit during weekdays for fewer crowds and try traditional Czech Easter specialties.

activities.name: Explore Prague Castle Gardens
activities.description: Stroll through the Royal Gardens and South Gardens of Prague Castle, featuring Renaissance landscaping and spring blooms.
activities.seasonal_notes: Spring weather is ideal for garden walks, with blooming tulips and comfortable temperatures.
activities.booking_tips: Gardens open in April - check opening times and combine with castle visit for best value.

activities.name: Vltava River Cruise
activities.description: Enjoy a leisurely cruise along the Vltava River, passing under famous bridges and seeing Prague's landmarks from the water.
activities.seasonal_notes: Springtime offers pleasant weather for river cruises, with clear views of the city's architecture.
activities.booking_tips: Book tickets in advance for weekend cruises and choose boats with outdoor decks for best views.

activities.name: Springtime Farmers Markets
activities.description: Explore local farmers markets like Náměstí Jiřího z Poděbrad, offering fresh spring produce, artisanal goods, and Czech specialties.
activities.seasonal_notes: Spring markets feature seasonal vegetables, fresh herbs, and early Czech fruits.
activities.booking_tips: Visit Saturday mornings for the best selection and bring reusable bags.

activities.name: Letná Beer Garden
activities.description: Enjoy Czech beer and traditional pub food at the largest beer garden in Prague, with stunning views over the Vltava River and Old Town.
activities.seasonal_notes: Summer evenings are perfect for beer garden enjoyment with long daylight hours and warm temperatures.
activities.booking_tips: Arrive early to secure a table with the best views, especially on weekends.

activities.name: Prague Spring International Music Festival
activities.description: Attend world-class classical concerts and performances at venues throughout Prague during this prestigious festival from May to June.
activities.seasonal_notes: Early summer brings this internationally renowned classical music festival to Prague.
activities.booking_tips: Book tickets well in advance for popular concerts and venues like the Municipal House.

activities.name: Open-Air Cinema at Křižík Fountain
activities.description: Watch Czech and international films under the stars at various outdoor cinema locations, including the spectacular fountain shows.
activities.seasonal_notes: Summer evenings are perfect for outdoor cinema, with warm temperatures and late sunsets.
activities.booking_tips: Bring a blanket and arrive early to secure good viewing spots for popular films.

activities.name: Karlštejn Castle Day Trip
activities.description: Take a day trip to the Gothic Karlštejn Castle, built by Emperor Charles IV, just 30 minutes from Prague by train.
activities.seasonal_notes: Summer offers the best weather for castle visits and hiking in the surrounding countryside.
activities.booking_tips: Book guided tours in advance and combine with hiking trails around the castle.

activities.name: United Islands of Prague Festival
activities.description: Enjoy this free multi-genre music festival held on Kampa Island and other locations, featuring local and international artists.
activities.seasonal_notes: This summer festival takes advantage of warm weather for outdoor performances on islands and parks.
activities.booking_tips: Check the lineup in advance and arrive early for popular acts to secure good spots.

activities.name: Cycling Along the Vltava
activities.description: Rent a bike and cycle along the Vltava River paths, enjoying scenic views and stopping at riverside cafés and beer gardens.
activities.seasonal_notes: Summer climate is ideal for cycling, with long daylight hours and warm temperatures.
activities.booking_tips: Use bike rental services or Prague's bike-sharing system and follow marked cycling routes.

activities.name: Rooftop Dining at Bellevue
activities.description: Dine at Bellevue Restaurant's terrace, offering fine Czech cuisine with spectacular views of Prague Castle and Charles Bridge.
activities.seasonal_notes: Summer evenings provide perfect conditions for rooftop dining with comfortable temperatures and stunning sunsets.
activities.booking_tips: Reserve terrace tables well in advance, especially for sunset dining hours.

activities.name: Visit to Kutná Hora
activities.description: Take a day trip to UNESCO World Heritage site Kutná Hora, featuring the famous Bone Church and Gothic St. Barbara's Cathedral.
activities.seasonal_notes: Summer offers ideal weather for day trips and exploring historic towns outside Prague.
activities.booking_tips: Take the train from Prague and book guided tours for deeper historical insights.

activities.name: Vltava Swimming and Beaches
activities.description: Cool off at Štvanice Island or other designated swimming areas along the Vltava River during hot summer days.
activities.seasonal_notes: Summer heat makes river swimming a refreshing activity for locals and visitors.
activities.booking_tips: Check water quality reports and swim only in designated safe areas.

activities.name: Explore Vyšehrad Cemetery
activities.description: Visit the final resting place of famous Czech composers and writers like Dvořák and Čapek, beautiful in autumn colors.
activities.seasonal_notes: Autumn foliage makes this cemetery particularly beautiful and atmospheric.
activities.booking_tips: Visit in the afternoon for best lighting and combine with exploring Vyšehrad fortress.

activities.name: Prague Design Week
activities.description: Experience contemporary Czech design at venues throughout Prague during this annual October festival showcasing local talent.
activities.seasonal_notes: Autumn brings this celebration of Czech creativity and design innovation.
activities.booking_tips: Check the program online and plan your route to visit multiple design studios and galleries.

activities.name: Wine Harvest Festival in Prague Vineyards
activities.description: Participate in wine harvest celebrations at Prague's vineyards in Troja and other districts, with wine tasting and traditional music.
activities.seasonal_notes: Autumn harvest season offers authentic wine experiences in Prague's own vineyards.
activities.booking_tips: Book vineyard tours in advance and dress appropriately for outdoor harvest activities.

activities.name: Visit to Convent of St. Agnes
activities.description: Explore medieval Czech art at this beautifully preserved Gothic convent, part of the National Gallery collection.
activities.seasonal_notes: Autumn's cooler days are perfect for indoor cultural activities and art appreciation.
activities.booking_tips: Purchase tickets online and consider combining with other National Gallery locations.

activities.name: Autumn Walk in Wenceslas Square
activities.description: Stroll down Prague's main boulevard, lined with shops, cafés, and historic buildings, beautiful in autumn atmosphere.
activities.seasonal_notes: Autumn provides perfect walking weather with comfortable temperatures and fewer tourists.
activities.booking_tips: Start at the National Museum and walk down to the Old Town for the full experience.

activities.name: Visit to Prague Jewish Museum
activities.description: Explore Europe's most extensive collection of Jewish artifacts at synagogues and the Old Jewish Cemetery.
activities.seasonal_notes: Autumn's shorter days make museums ideal for cultural and educational experiences.
activities.booking_tips: Buy combination tickets for all synagogues and cemetery, and allow several hours for the visit.

activities.name: St. Martin's Day Wine Celebrations
activities.description: Celebrate St. Martin's Day (November 11) with traditional goose dinners and young wine tastings at restaurants throughout Prague.
activities.seasonal_notes: This autumn tradition marks the release of young wines and seasonal goose dishes.
activities.booking_tips: Make restaurant reservations well in advance for St. Martin's Day celebrations.

activities.name: Explore Vinohrady District
activities.description: Wander through Prague's most elegant residential district, admiring Art Nouveau architecture and local cafés.
activities.seasonal_notes: Autumn colors enhance the beauty of this tree-lined residential area.
activities.booking_tips: Start at Náměstí Míru and explore the side streets for hidden architectural gems.

activities.name: Traditional Czech Cooking Class
activities.description: Learn to cook traditional Czech autumn dishes like goulash, svíčková, and seasonal specialties with local chefs.
activities.seasonal_notes: Autumn's harvest provides perfect ingredients for learning traditional Czech cooking.
activities.booking_tips: Book classes in advance and look for sessions that include market visits.

activities.name: Ice Skating at Ovocný trh
activities.description: Enjoy ice skating on the outdoor rink set up near Wenceslas Square, a popular winter activity for families and couples.
activities.seasonal_notes: Winter transforms Prague with ice rinks and festive atmosphere throughout the city.
activities.booking_tips: Skate rentals are available on-site, but bring warm clothes and arrive early on weekends.

activities.name: Christmas Markets at Old Town Square
activities.description: Experience magical Christmas markets with traditional Czech crafts, mulled wine (svařák), trdelník, and festive decorations.
activities.seasonal_notes: Winter markets are a quintessential Prague experience, running from late November through January.
activities.booking_tips: Visit in the evening for the best atmosphere with Christmas lights and fewer daytime crowds.

activities.name: Concert at St. Vitus Cathedral
activities.description: Experience classical music concerts in the stunning Gothic setting of St. Vitus Cathedral within Prague Castle.
activities.seasonal_notes: Winter evenings provide perfect atmosphere for classical concerts in historic venues.
activities.booking_tips: Book tickets well in advance as Christmas and New Year concerts sell out quickly.

activities.name: Visit to Prague Castle in Winter
activities.description: Explore Prague Castle complex with fewer crowds, including St. Vitus Cathedral, Royal Palace, and beautiful winter views.
activities.seasonal_notes: Winter offers fewer crowds and a magical atmosphere with possible snow on the castle grounds.
activities.booking_tips: Buy tickets online to skip lines and dress warmly for outdoor areas of the complex.

activities.name: Hot Wine at Christmas Markets
activities.description: Warm up with traditional Czech mulled wine (svařák) and hot mead at Christmas markets throughout the city.
activities.seasonal_notes: Winter is the perfect season for enjoying warm beverages at festive markets.
activities.booking_tips: Try different market locations for varying atmospheres - Old Town Square, Wenceslas Square, and Náměstí Míru.

activities.name: Visit to Lobkowicz Palace
activities.description: Explore the private Lobkowicz collection within Prague Castle, featuring art, musical instruments, and historical artifacts.
activities.seasonal_notes: Winter's cold makes indoor palace visits ideal for cultural enrichment and warmth.
activities.booking_tips: Purchase tickets online and consider the audio guide featuring Prince Lobkowicz personally.

activities.name: New Year's Eve Fireworks
activities.description: Celebrate New Year's Eve with spectacular fireworks over the Vltava River and festivities throughout the city center.
activities.seasonal_notes: Winter celebrations offer magical atmosphere with illuminated historic buildings and festive crowds.
activities.booking_tips: Arrive early to secure good viewing spots near the river or major squares, and dress very warmly.

activities.name: Traditional Czech Pub Experience
activities.description: Warm up in traditional Czech pubs like U Fleků or U Zlatého tygra with hearty winter dishes and Czech beer.
activities.seasonal_notes: Winter evenings are perfect for cozy pub experiences with traditional Czech comfort food.
activities.booking_tips: Try historic pubs for authentic atmosphere and order traditional winter dishes like goulash or svíčková.

activities.name: Spa Day at Beer Spa
activities.description: Relax in warm beer baths at one of Prague's unique beer spas, combining wellness with Czech beer culture.
activities.seasonal_notes: Winter is ideal for warm spa treatments, offering relief from cold weather.
activities.booking_tips: Book treatments in advance and combine with traditional Czech massage for full relaxation.

ranges.notes: Major holiday - most attractions closed, cold weather (-2 to 2°C), post-celebration cleanup, limited transport
considerations: Excellent for photography with fewer crowds

ranges.notes: Post-holiday recovery, gradual reopening, winter sales begin, very cold (0-4°C)
Traditional Czech celebration, bakeries busy with special pastries, winter atmosphere
ranges.culturalSignificance: Important Czech tradition - try traditional Three Kings cake at local bakeries

ranges.notes: Coldest period (-1 to 3°C), possible snow, ideal for indoor activities, very low tourism

Winter continues, cold (0-4°C), fewer crowds, excellent museum time

schoolHolidays.description: Winter school holidays - increased family tourism

ranges.notes: Romantic atmosphere, special dining events, busy restaurants, book 2-3 weeks ahead

Spring awakening, pleasant temperatures (5-12°C), perfect for walking
considerations: Perfect time for Charles Bridge walks

ranges.notes: Spring officially arrives, excellent conditions (6-13°C), Easter preparations begin

easterPreparations.markets: Easter decorations at Old Town Square

ranges.notes: Fun cultural atmosphere, spring weather, Easter preparations
ranges.culturalTradition: Czech April Fool's traditions, playful atmosphere throughout the city

ranges.notes: Easter markets in full swing, ideal weather (8-15°C), traditional Czech Easter celebrations
ranges.location: Old Town Square and Wenceslas Square

ranges.notes: Perfect spring conditions (10-16°C), comfortable temperatures, ideal sightseeing

specialConsiderations.easter: Major Christian holiday affects opening hours and creates family tourism spike
specialConsiderations.schoolHolidays: Two weeks of increased family tourism from all regions
specialConsiderations.weather: Most stable spring weather but sudden showers possible

ranges.notes: Many closures but special events, traditional celebrations
Some closures, commemorations, historical significance
Excellent weather (12-18°C), spring flowers, outdoor dining, perfect for sightseeing
International music festival, warm weather (14-20°C), outdoor cafés thriving
Excellent weather (15-22°C), long daylight, pre-peak season
Warming up, tourism increasing, still manageable crowds
Longest day of the year, outdoor celebrations, beer garden season begins
Summer begins, increasing tourism, warm weather (16-23°C)
Peak tourism season, warm weather (17-24°C), crowded attractions
Hot weather (18-25°C), peak tourism, crowded, outdoor beer gardens active
Hot weather (17-25°C), outdoor festivals, many locals on vacation, some closures
Still warm, crowds decreasing as European vacations end, more manageable
Excellent post-peak season, warm weather continues (14-20°C), fewer crowds
Pleasant temperatures, reduced crowds, cultural events, beer celebrations
National holiday, cultural events, fall colors beginning
Comfortable temperatures (9-15°C), beautiful autumn atmosphere, golden light
Fall colors, harvest activities, traditional Czech celebrations, autumn charm
Holiday, some closures but special cemetery visits, traditional observances
National holiday, commemorations, historical significance
Festive atmosphere begins, cooler weather (4-10°C), holiday preparations
Festive atmosphere, holiday decorations, mulled wine (svařák), traditional treats
Holiday events, Christmas shopping crowds, festive lights
Many closures but special atmosphere, family celebrations
Public holiday, gradual reopening, post-Christmas atmosphere
Between Christmas and New Year's - busy tourist period, sales begin
Special events but very crowded, fireworks at Old Town Square

scoreDescription.1: Poor: Unfavorable conditions, extreme weather, overcrowded or limited activities, poor value
scoreDescription.2: Below Average: Less ideal conditions, possibly unpleasant weather or very high crowds, limited value
scoreDescription.3: Average: Standard conditions, typical weather, moderate to high tourism, fair value
scoreDescription.4: Good: Very favorable conditions, pleasant weather, manageable crowds, good value
scoreDescription.5: Excellent: Perfect conditions, special events, ideal weather, moderate crowds, best value

metro.airConditioning: Modern trains have AC, older lines limited

valuePricing.strategy: Book 2-3 months ahead for best rates

accommodation.airConditioning: Essential July-August, many historic hotels lack AC

closures.august: Some local restaurants close for owner vacations
closures.holidays: Christmas Day, New Year's Day, Easter Sunday
closures.sunday: Many traditional pubs have limited hours

monthlyHighlights.january: Winter sales, cozy pubs, authentic local experience
monthlyHighlights.february: Fewer crowds, cultural immersion, romantic atmosphere
monthlyHighlights.march: Spring awakening, Easter preparations, perfect temperatures
monthlyHighlights.april: Easter markets peak, ideal weather, traditional celebrations
monthlyHighlights.may: Perfect conditions, Prague Spring Festival, optimal sightseeing
monthlyHighlights.june: Longest days, beer garden season, pre-peak crowds
monthlyHighlights.july: Peak summer, beer festivals, outdoor celebrations
monthlyHighlights.august: Hot weather, outdoor festivals, many locals away
monthlyHighlights.september: Post-peak perfection, autumn festivals, ideal conditions
monthlyHighlights.october: Autumn beauty, harvest celebrations, comfortable temperatures
monthlyHighlights.november: Cozy atmosphere, Christmas markets begin, cultural season
monthlyHighlights.december: Christmas magic, holiday markets, festive atmosphere

weatherNotes.spring: Variable weather, layers recommended, occasional rain
weatherNotes.summer: Warm to hot, occasional thunderstorms, pleasant evenings
weatherNotes.autumn: Gradually cooling, beautiful colors, comfortable for walking
weatherNotes.winter: Cold but rarely extreme, occasional snow, indoor activities recommended

transportation.metro: Efficient year-round, some lines have limited air-conditioning
transportation.walking: Best in spring and autumn, challenging in extreme weather
transportation.cycling: Excellent in spring and autumn, bike lanes available

accommodation.advanceBooking: Recommended 3-6 months ahead for peak season
